DataElement.preferredDefinition: The histologic changes in a biospecimen that are associated with pre-malignant conditions not previously listed.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Microscopic Findings Domain Biospecimen Premalignant Change
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to microscopic findings._Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._Descriptive of a condition that may or is likely to become cancerous._The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to microscopic findings.

Concepts.definition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to microscopic findings.

Property.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.:Descriptive of a condition that may or is likely to become cancerous.:The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.

Concepts.definition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.
Descriptive of a condition that may or is likely to become cancerous.
The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CDISC Aligned NCI Standard Equivalent CDE
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is to be used for CDISC aligned data collection in place of CDE 64300 from the original NCI Standard CRF Template.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CTEP Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: If associated pre-malignant histologic change is "other", specify other change

ReferenceDocuments.name: CTEP Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Specify other associated pre-malignant histologic changes
